intro: Psychotria macrochlamys, commonly known as the large-lipped psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly in countries like Colombia and Ecuador. The plant is characterized by its dark green, glossy leaves and striking, tubular flowers that range in color from white to purple. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, often found in understory layers of tropical forests. Psychotria macrochlamys is also known for its chemical compounds, some of which have been studied for their potential pharmacological properties.
